messages.title: A future fair for all in Warrington South
putting your concerns first and foremost

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support the economic recovery to protect people's jobs and futures.
Champion greater opportunities for all our young people school, college, university, training and work.
Stand up for the interests of older residents, protecting the Winter Fuel Allowance, free bus travel and free TV licences.

Championing major investment in local schools to support the next generation, including a pledge to rebuild and refurbish Penketh High and Sir Thomas Boteler respectively under the Building Schools for the Future scheme.
Strive for the health services people rely on to continue to improve, including the right to see a cancer specialist within 2 weeks.

issues.economy: Support the economic recovery to protect people's jobs and futures.
issues.education: Championing major investment in local schools to support the next generation, including a pledge to rebuild and refurbish Penketh High and Sir Thomas Boteler respectively under the Building Schools for the Future scheme.
issues.health: Strive for the health services people rely on to continue to improve, including the right to see a cancer specialist within 2 weeks.
issues.socialWelfare: Stand up for the interests of older residents, protecting the Winter Fuel Allowance, free bus travel and free TV licences.

quotes.text: I don't trust Cameron and Osborne. They are sly, and I'm convinced that the Tories do not want Warrington to thrive.
I admire Nick and I know he would serve the whole constituency very well. So I hope people will vote for Nick and keep the Tories out of power.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Labour has promised funds to rebuild and refurbish Penketh High and Sir Thomas Boteler respectively under the Building Schools for the Future scheme. Labour understands and supports people's aspirations.
